is an open-source manual travel logger where you can log your location, with a name and description. As it is manual, it does not waste your device's battery life. It also does not require internet access.
 
To use, first start with New Trip from the menu. This will be the KML filename of the blog (located in /TravelBlog/ on your SD card). Now when you want to log your location, just click on New Post. This brings up a new page where you can type a name and description. While you are typing, it finds your location by GPS (if enabled and available), or by WiFi / Cell-id (network). Once GPS location has been found, it will auto-turn off GPS to save battery life. If you are unhappy with the GPS fix, you can ask it to retry a location fix.
 
Now click Save, or Cancel to cancel. When you save, the KML file automatically adds a line from your previous location. You can also edit or delete a previous post by long-clicking on a post. When editing you a given the opportunity to edit the name and description, and optionally to reapply the location fix to your post.
 
Whenever you choose, you can view your trip on a Google map on your device by choosing Map Trip from the menu. You can copy the KML blog file manually to do what you choose with it, or you can send it via email or whereever your device can send it to by choosing Send Trip from the menu.
 
What works well for us is to install the Android Dropbox app, register with Dropbox, and then Send the KML file to your Dropbox public folder. In Dropbox you can get a link to your file which you can enter into the Search Maps box in Google Maps. This works from either the desktop Google Maps, or the mobile Google Maps app. You can then share this map with friends, or add it to your favourite Blogging website such as Blogger. This way, your family, friends or colleagues can also know what you are up to.
 
Later you can Open Trip to load old trips, or select new Trip again to start again. Your last Trip is also loaded on start-up. Nothing runs in the background.
 
If you have problems, please visit our pages at http://code.google.com/p/travel-blog-android/
 
Happy travelling!
 
The Travel Blog Team
